doc.title: Cartoneros
doc.plot: Pachamama, the mother land of the native culture, drags herself on the floor collecting her daily requirements. Character of thrift and tolerance, the puppet is moved by the hands of a Tiritera (a puppeteer) who tells the unexpected adventures in the street theater of Buenos Aires. Pachamama, alike the ancient gleaners of the European culture, who scattered on the fields, once the harvest being over, in order to collect a source of maintenance - nowadays a new people of workers invade downtown Buenos Aires, the richest city of South America. They are the Cartoneros, that leave their districts within the neverending city periphery belt, and push and drag their supermarket trolleys. They seek in the garbage what is marketable. They divide white paper from the cardboard, collect and trade it by road marketing leader.
